instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2390: What is 820-2390? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps rebooting
threads.message: Hi Guys, i know its an oldy but customer wants to pay to fix and its not busy, so...... This <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keep chiming and high fan spin. Tried to run it with everything disconnected and a new keyboard, same. Before I start check anything, do these have GPU or vram issues? Its better not to try and fix?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps rebooting
threads.message:
Check first resistance (ohm mode) to ground at 3V42.
Less than 30K will point to bad MCP.
However MCP is very old now; maybe not worth to spend time with.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps rebooting
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps rebooting
threads.message: Yeah prob a waste of time sadly
